title: Police: Woman beaten, held captive for 2 days in Bellingham
text:
Police said a Bellingham woman was repeatedly beaten and held captive by a man she had believed was her friend.
Quick Facts:
Woman had known man for 2 years She was lured to his home where she was beaten and held for 2 days She escaped when he fell asleep Man arrested on kidnapping and assault charges
Whatcom County deputies said they were called to a home Thursday where an injured woman had bruises on her head, face, hands and arms.
The victim was conscious and was able to give police some initial details as she was treated by medics before being was transported to the hospital.
The 30-year-old victim said a friend she has known for about two years lured her to his home in the 2900 block of East Smith Road in Bellingham late Tuesday evening, asking her to help him catch some chickens.
The victim told detectives that the man, identified as Robert D. McGlothern, held her at his home, an apartment separate from his parent’s home on the same property, for two days.
The victim said he locked her in a closet, repeatedly hit her with a baseball bat and brandished a handgun at one point.
Police said a family member of the victim went to the man’s apartment on Wednesday looking for her after the victim’s employer called saying she did not show up for work.
The man told the family member that the victim was not there and that she had left with a man from Everson, according to police.
The victim was later able to escape the apartment on Wednesday afternoon after the man fell asleep.
She then contacted his father at his nearby home and asked for a ride home. The father told detectives that the victim appeared to have been beaten.
Police went to McGlothern’s apartment and blocked off surrounding roads. A SWAT team tried to make contact with the man, but he failed to respond. After a seven-hour standoff, officers entered the home and McGlothern was taken into custody at 3 a.m. Friday.
Police said he was found hiding in a meat locker that had been converted into a bedroom.
Two loaded guns, a rifle and shotgun, were found in his apartment, according to investigators.
Police said the woman had injuries to her head, face, torso, arms, legs and hands. She is expected to survive.
The Sheriff’s Office says McGlothern has a previous history of assault arrests involving former girlfriends in 2013, 2014 and in July.
He was booked into the Whatcom County Jail on kidnapping and assault charges.
